intro: Tapura cubensis subsp. cubensis, commonly known as the Cuban tapura, is a species of flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, red berries that contain seeds, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
